p: For the cpSSR data, HAPLOTYPE v.1.05 [ 51] was used to estimate the number of alleles at chloroplast SSR loci (N acpSSR), number of haplotypes detected in each population (N b), effective number of haplotypes (N e), genetic diversity (Dv), haplotype richness (H r) and the number of private haplotypes (Prv). A parsimony network illustrating genetic relationships between haplotypes was inferred using the software PopArt [ 52], assuming single-step mutations between alleles. Total genetic variation among samples was calculated using the phi-statistics of AMOVA which was performed using GenAlex [ 50]. This total variation was partitioned at three levelsâ€”within populations (Phi-PT), among populations within clusters (Phi-PR), and among clusters (Phi-RT) [ 53].
